actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

official_title: To amend part D of title IV of the Social Security Act to make it clear that the existing authority to collect past-due child support from Federal tax refunds (under section 464 of that Act), to the extent that such support remains unpaid when the child involved reaches the age of majority, may be exercised after the child reaches that age.

summary.text: Amends part D (Child Support and Establishment of Paternity) of title IV of the Social Security Act to make it explicit that the authority to withhold past-due child support from an individual's Federal tax refunds may be exercised after such child reaches the age of majority.

titles.title: To amend part D of title IV of the Social Security Act to make it clear that the existing authority to collect past-due child support from Federal tax refunds (under section 464 of that Act), to the extent that such support remains unpaid when the child involved reaches the age of majority, may be exercised after the child reaches that age.
